attributes.action: Build a small-ish paved mountain bike park or pump track in brightlingsea
attributes.additional_details: I would like the goverment to put this in place because as a mountain biker myself, I have no wheee local to ride. This has resulted in my and my friends to ride features like the stairs down in the mariner. As a result of being in a public place, we have had loads of encouragement for what we are doing from locals that mountain bike them selves. We have also had complaints and been shouted at for it as we are in a public space. I believe that the MTB park (or pump track) would keep people happy.
attributes.background: I would love to see a MTB (mountain bike) park in brightlingsea, maybe a small paved one with lots of jumps and berms, it would mean that it is low maintenance as the concrete won’t get damaged by tire tracks. Brightlingsea is a small town but a MTB park would really bring people in to the town.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local amenities are a matter for your local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
